subject: Re: [junit] JMock question
msgSnippet: ... IIRC there have been lots of discussions around this topic in the past. And I don t think there is a one-and-only one answer to it: people using JMock will
messageBody:
On 7/16/07, Mark Levison <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> I'm finally playing around with mocking frameworks and am struggling
> to decide between RMock 2.0 and JMock 1.2 (we're stuck at Java1.4).
>
> I'm attracted to the clear language of the JMock interface but I'm
> just stuck on the fact that it uses strings to refer to methods.
>
> So I'm wondering do regular users find they have problems with
> changing method names?
>

IIRC there have been lots of discussions around this topic in the
past. And I don't think there is a one-and-only one answer to it:
people using JMock will say there is no problem with it, while people
using the alternatives (f.e.EasyMock) will probably say it was a big
deal for them.

And I think the only one that can decide it is you (and only you - as
in you and your team, you and your project, you and your env).

bests,
./alex
--
.w( the_mindstorm )p.

EclipseTestNG Creator
